page.title: 13Law and Order
page.content: There are no police stationed in the area, but the villages are covered by a system of Community Policing. Teams of eight policemen based at Chippenham regularly patrol groups of local villages. The nearest magistrates court is in Chippenham. In the press the most commonly reported crimes are burgularies from private homes. The most noteable crime in Sutton Benger was the murder of a 58 year old widow, Judith Pearce,in November 1820. Her murderer was a gipsy, Edward Buckland, who was the last person to be publicly hanged in Devizes market place in March 1821. A tombstone in memory of Judith Pearce was erected by public subscription and can be seen in the churchyard.
